constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CONARA Conservation Area: FORE STREET NORTH
CILRES CIL ZONE: Lower Rate Eastern Zone - RATE: £40 per square metre
DMDCA Designation: Conservation Area- Name: FORE STREET NORTH- Policy: DMD 37-44- Core Strategy: Core policy 30-31
DMDDC Designation: District Centre- Name: Edmonton Green- Policy: DMD 25, 27, 30-36- Core Strategy: Core policies 17-19

description: A mixed use development comprising the partial demolition of 361-363 Fore Street, and the erection of a 4-storey building, to provide a Supermarket (Class Ea) at ground floor, a Restaurant (Class Eb) at first floor, 9 residential units at third and fourth floor, and all associated works.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the decision notice. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting or modifying that Order, no development under the following classes shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority:a.	Article 3, Schedule 2, Part 1 Classes A, B,  D, E, F, G and Hb.        Article 3, Schedule 2, Part 2, Class AReason: In order to protect the amenities of the adjoining occupiers, to ensure adequate amenity space is retained for each of the dwellings in accordance with adopted Policy, and to maintain a satisfactory appearance to the development and the wider Conservation Area.

The development shall not be occupied until a proposal for external lighting for the new dwellings has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved external lighting shall be installed before the development is occupied and maintained in perpetuity.  Reason: To ensure the safety of development occupants and ensure that the development does not prejudice the amenities of adjoining occupiers and / or the visual amenities of the Conservation Area.

That prior to the commencement of any highway works listed below and as depicted on the drawing no 1200 Rev P3 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan that form part of the approved Transport Statement, drawings and details of the works shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to occupation of the development hereby approved. a)	on street accessible parking space;b)	loading bay;c)	dropped kerbs for accessible parking space and loading bay;d)       permit holder parkingReason: In the interests of highway safety.

Prior to their use, sample panels together with detailed drawings and manufacturers technical information for all exterior brickwork shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The sample panel shall indicate brick bonds together with mortar mix, colour and pointing profile and should remain on the application site for the duration of the construction works. Detailed drawings shall include brick details to achieve relief in colour, texture and pattern. The works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently maintained as such.Reason: In the interests of delivering good design and not harming the character and appearance of the Fore Street conservation area.

Prior to their use, a schedule specifying all external materials to be used shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently maintained as such.Reason: In the interests of delivering good design and not harming the character and appearance of the Fore Street conservation area.

Prior to their insertion, additional drawings that show details of proposed new windows; doors; lintels; dormers; moulded cornices; parapets; shopfronts; balconies; railings; soffits and rainwater goods by section and elevation at a scales of between 1:20 and 1:1 as appropriate shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently maintained as such.Reason: In the interests of delivering good design and not harming the character and appearance of the Fore Street conservation area.

(a)	No demolition or conversion can commence until a programme of historic building recording has been secured and undertaken in accordance with a written scheme of investigation which has been submitted by the applicant, and approved by the planning authority.(b) The applicant will submit to the local planning authority an approved historic building report (to be submitted within six months of the completion of fieldwork, unless otherwise agreed in advance with the Planning Authority in consultation with the Greater London Archaeology Advice Service). This report shall be submitted to the Greater London Historic Environment Record and Enfield Local Studies Library in accordance with their guidelines and best practice.

No development shall take place until a Construction Management Plan, written in accordance with the Mayor of London's supplementary planning guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition' detailing how dust, emissions and traffic will be managed during demolition and construction work shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval. The statement should also include:a) photographic condition survey of public carriageways, verges and footways in the vicinity of the site;b) map showing routeing of demolition and construction vehicles to/from the site;c) access arrangements for deliveries to the site;d) wheel cleaning methodology and facilities or measures to keep the highway clear of mud and debris.Once approved the Construction Management Plan shall be fully implemented for the duration of any demolition and construction works. Reason: To protect the local amenity from demolition/construction dust as well as traffic impacts to the setting.

Prior to occupation of the development, details of refuse storage facilities including facilities for the recycling of waste to be provided within the development, in accordance with the London Borough of Enfield Waste and Recycling Planning Storage Guidance ENV 08/162, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The facilities shall be provided in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied or use commences and maintained as such thereafter.Reason: In the interests of amenity and the recycling of waste materials in support of the Boroughs waste reduction targets.

Following the practical completion of the development, an updated Energy Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, reflecting the measures taken in practice in Be Lean, Be Clean and Be Green stages of the Energy hierarchy to reduce carbon emitted from the operation of a development and its services, as committed to in the design stage, and the amended New Development Carbon Compensation to be paid for the remaining emissions.Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that CO2 emission reduction targets by renewable energy are met in accordance with Policies DMD51-54 of the Development Management Document (2014) and Policy SI 2 of the New London Plan 2021.

Prior to commencement of superstructure works, an overheating risk assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved strategy shall be implemented prior to first occupation and maintained on site. Reason: To ensure suitable conditions within the development and that the buildings do not overheat, in accordance with London Plan Policy SI 4 Managing heat risk.

The development hereby approved shall achieve a BREEAM rating of 'Excellent' or higher or an equivalent independent measure of energy performance and sustainability. Where the performance of the development is measured using BREEAM, it shall achieve not less than the total credits for each of the Energy, Materials and Waste categories in the BREEAM Pre-Assessment hereby approved. A post completion certificate (or equivalent certification) confirming that the development has been completed in accordance with the required BREEAM rating and has maintained or exceeded the approved total credit scores for each of the Energy, Materials and Waste categories, shall be submitted to us for our approval within three months of first occupation of the development. Reason: To ensure the development minimizes operational carbon dioxide emissions and achieves the highest levels of sustainable design and construction in accordance with DMD51 of the Development Management Document (2014).

At time of development, and in perpetuity no meter boxes (electricity, internet, gas or water meter); service intakes; soil ventilation pipes; rainwater goods; air-conditioning units; air extraction pipes; boiler flues or ducting shall be fixed to the external fabric of the building other than those shown on the approved drawings.Reason: In the interests of delivering good design and not harming the character and appearance of the Fore Street conservation area.

No part of the development shall be occupied until a site wide Delivery and Servicing Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This shall then be implemented as approved and remain in operation for the lifetime of the development. Reason: In order to ensure that deliveries and servicing of the site is managed effectively so as to minimise impact upon the road network and to safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of residential properties and in the interests of road safety.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:Location Plan - 000  Rev. P1Existing Block Plan - 001 Rev. P1Proposed Block Plan - 002 Rev. P1Proposed Second Floor Plan - 1202 Rev. P2Proposed Roof Plan - 1204 Rev. P2Proposed Side Elevation Plan (Warriner Dr.) - 1206 Rev. P2Proposed Section AA Plan - 1209 Rev. P2Proposed Rear Elevation Plan - 1207 Rev. P2Proposed Front Elevation Plan - 1205 Rev. P2Proposed First Floor Plan - 1201 Rev. P2Demolition Ground Floor Plan - 1100 Rev. P1Demolition Mezzanine Floor Plan - 1101 Rev. P1Demolition Long Section A Plan - 1115 Rev. P1Demolition Side Elevation Plan - 1112 Rev. P1Bauder Green Roof Section Plan - C126-04 Rev. ASunlight & Daylight AssessmentPre-development Impermeable Area Plan - C3126-01 Rev. BPost-development Impermeable Area Plan - C3126-02 Rev. BHeritage StatementFire Strategy ReportUrban Greening FactorFlood Risk Assessment and Drainage StrategyHealth Impact AssessmentTransport AssessmentOther documents submitted for consideration:BREEAM Pre-Assessment and Strategy by Carbon ConsultSustainable Design and Construction by JS Lewis LtdDesign and Access StatementSite Waste Management PlanNoise Impact AssessmentReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Prior to occupation, the development shall achieve a Certificate of Compliance to the relevant Secure by Design Guide(s) or alternatively achieve Crime Prevention Standards submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in conjunction with the Metropolitan Police. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter shall be fully retained and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.Reason: In the interest of creating safer, secure, sustainable communities.

Prior to the use commencing, an acoustic report must be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority demonstrating, by the performance of a sound insulation test, that the airborne sound attenuation of the floors/separating walls between the commercial uses, plant room and the residential flats have a minimum airborne sound insulation performance of DnT,w + Ctr $455dB.Reason: To protect the residential amenity from noise and disturbance

Following practical completion of works a final Energy Performance Certificate shall be submitted to an approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  In the interest of sustainable development and to ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that CO2 emission reduction targets are met in accordance with Policy CP20 of the Core Strategy, relevant energy policies of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2024).

The developer shall provide the flats with an alternative means of ventilation other than openable windows or trickle vents. The details of the ventilation system shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development being occupied.Reason: To protect the local amenity from noise and disturbance

Prior to the occupation of the development, details of a landscaping scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The detailed landscaping scheme shall include the following details:  1.         Schedules of plants/trees, to include native and wildlife friendly species and large canopy plantst/trees in appropriate locations (noting species, planting sizes and proposed numbers / densities) to be planted;2.         soft plantings: including grass and turf areas, shrub and herbaceous areas; All landscaping in accordance with the approved scheme shall be completed/planted in full during the first planting season following practical completion of the development hereby approved.  The landscaping and planting shall set out a plan for the continued management and maintenance of the site and any planting which dies, becomes severely damaged or diseased within five years of completion of the development shall be replaced with new planting in accordance with the approved details or an approved alternative and to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and shall be maintained as such thereafter.  Reason: To minimise the impact of the development on the ecological value of the area, to ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity and to preserve the character and appearance of the area.

Prior to the occupation of the new dwellings hereby approved, full details of boundary treatments shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance

Prior to the commencement of development above ground works, full details of the surfacing materials to be used within the development including pedestrian access shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The surfacing shall be carried out in accordance with the approved detail before the development is occupied or use commences. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory visual appearance and in the in interests of highways safety.
